intro: Galium gardneri, commonly known as Gardner's bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite and often have a hairy texture, while its fruits are small, dry capsules. Galium gardneri plays a role in supporting local insect populations and contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
